org.gruple
Class Space

java.lang.Object
  org.gruple.Space

class Space

Class representing a tuplespace. Tuples {

Link:
Tuple} can be inserted, read, and removed using put(), get(), and take() respectively. Fields in a tuple are named, but not ordered. Only immutable objects may be added to a Tuple. This includes the following types:
  • Integer
  • Short
  • Long
  • Byte
  • Float
  • Double
  • BigInteger
  • BigDecimal
  • Boolean
  • Character
  • String
  • URI
  • Date (we assume no deprecated methods are ever used)
  • Enum types
  • Classes using the
Immutable:
annotation
  • Collections and Maps of any of the above
    • Note that Arrays are not supported as Tuple fields because they can't be made immutable.
    see:
    groovy.lang.Tuple
    author:
    Vanessa Williams

    Property Detail

    FOREVER

    public static final java.lang.Long FOREVER
    Convenience constant to indicate indefinite ttl for put tuples. This is the default value.

    NO_WAIT

    public static final java.lang.Long NO_WAIT
    Convenience constant to indicate immediate return from get() and take() operations.

    WAIT_FOREVER

    public static final java.lang.Long WAIT_FOREVER
    Convenience constant to indicate indefinite wait for get() and take() operations. Note that this is the default if no timeout is supplied, so the constant is necessary only for clarity.

    name

    final java.lang.String name
    The space name. Required to look up a reference to a particular space.

     
    Constructor Detail

    Space

    protected Space(java.lang.String name)
    Creates a new instance of TupleSpace. Not called by applications, use SpaceService.getSpace(name) instead.

     
    Method Detail

    close

    protected def close()
    Close a space. Clears out all data structures, and notifies all waiting threads, so use with caution. Not called directly by applications. Use SpaceService.close(String name) instead.

    commit

    protected def commit(Transaction txn)
    Commit the transaction for this space. Should not be called by applications. Use Transaction.commit() instead.
    see:
    Transaction

    enroll

    protected def enroll(Transaction txn)

    get

    java.util.Map get(java.util.Map templateFields, java.lang.Long timeout = WAIT_FOREVER, Transaction txn = null)
    Non-destructive read of a tuple which matches the template. Templates use null as wildcard field values.
    param:
    a Map of template fields (must adhere to rules for {@Link Tuple})
    param:
    timeout in milliseconds; 0 returns immediately; default is -1(=WAIT_FOREVER)
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    a Map of the matched Tuple's fields or null if no match found

    get

    java.util.Map get(java.util.Map templateFields, groovy.time.TimeDuration timeout, Transaction txn = null)
    Convenience function allowing the use of TimeCategory for the timeout parameter. e.g. use(TimeCategory) { get([field1:1, field2:null], 2.minutes) }
    param:
    a map of tuple fields
    param:
    a Duration for the tuple's time-to-live
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    a Map of the matched Tuple's fields or null if no match found

    get

    protected Tuple get(Tuple antiTuple, java.lang.Long timeout = WAIT_FOREVER, Transaction txn = null)
    Non-destructive read of a tuple which matches the template. Templates use null as wildcard field values. Applications should use the get(Map, Long) and get(Map, Duration) versions.
    param:
    template to match
    param:
    timeout time to block for; 0 returns immediately, -1(=WAIT_FOREVER) is the default. Other values are in milliseconds
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    the matched Tuple or null if none found

    getStats

    protected java.lang.String getStats()

    leftShift

    void leftShift(java.util.Map tupleFields)
    Override leftShift to "append" a map (as Tuple) to the space with default ttl
    param:
    the map of {@Link Tuple} fields to insert

    put

    void put(java.util.Map tupleFields, java.lang.Long ttl = FOREVER, Transaction txn = null )
    Insert a map as a tuple into the space. If the map provided does not conform to the requirements for tuples {
    Link:
    Tuple} (immutable value types only, string keys only) an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
    see:
    groovy.lang.Tuple
    param:
    a map of tuple fields
    param:
    the tuple's time-to-live in milliseconds. -1(=FOREVER) is the default
    param:
    Transaction, default is null

    put

    void put(java.util.Map tupleFields, groovy.time.TimeDuration ttl, Transaction txn = null)
    Convenience function allowing the use of TimeCategory for the ttl parameter. e.g. use(TimeCategory) { put([field1:1, field2:2], 2.minutes) }
    param:
    a map of {@Link Tuple} fields
    param:
    a Duration for the tuple's time-to-live
    param:
    Transaction, default is null

    put

    protected void put(Tuple tuple, java.lang.Long ttl = FOREVER, Transaction txn = null)
    Insert a tuple into the space. Applications should use the put(Map, Long) and put(Map, Duration versions).
    param:
    the tuple to insert. May not be null.
    param:
    the tuple's time-to-live in milliseconds. -1(=FOREVER) is the default
    param:
    Transaction, default is null

    rollback

    protected def rollback(Transaction txn)
    Rollback the transaction for this space. Should not be called by applications. Use Transaction.rollback() instead.
    see:
    Transaction

    take

    java.util.Map take(java.util.Map templateFields, java.lang.Long timeout = WAIT_FOREVER, Transaction txn = null)
    Consume a tuple which matches the template. Templates use null as wildcard field values.
    param:
    a Map of template fields (must adhere to rules for {@Link Tuple})
    param:
    timeout in milliseconds; 0 returns immediately; default is -1(=WAIT_FOREVER)
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    a Map of the matched Tuple's fields or null if no match found

    take

    java.util.Map take(java.util.Map templateFields, groovy.time.TimeDuration timeout, Transaction txn = null)
    Convenience function allowing the use of TimeCategory for the timeout parameter. e.g. use(TimeCategory) { take([field1:1, field2:null], 2.minutes) }
    param:
    a map of fields
    param:
    a Duration for the tuple's time-to-live
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    a Map of the matched Tuple's fields or null if no match found

    take

    protected Tuple take(Tuple antiTuple, java.lang.Long timeout = WAIT_FOREVER, Transaction txn = null)
    Consume a tuple which matches the template. Templates use null as wildcard field values. Applications should use the take(Map, Long) and take(Map, Duration) versions.
    param:
    a template to match.
    param:
    timeout time to block for; 0 returns immediately, -1(=WAIT_FOREVER) is the default. Other values are in milliseconds.
    param:
    Transaction, default is null
    throws:
    InterruptedException (for the sake of Java clients)
    return:
    found tuple, or null if none found within timeout
